Reviews.Title: “Above average..”
Reviews.Author: Meleana M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kutuma is nothing but a fairly priced hotel with weird decor and friendly staff. The location is great, on Rue Saint-Denis there are many bakeries, restaurants and bars that you can choose from. The room was a fair size with kitchen facilities, which were not the cleanest. It appeared that the glasses that were placed in our room were reused and were not cleaned. I used a glass on my first night and the following day after the room was cleaned, the same glass was on the table. I knew it was the same one as my lipstick from the day before was imprinted on the rim. Upon arriving, we called to order lunch, they had advised that the kitchen is closed, the following morning we heard the same excuse, and lastly the morning of our departure the same excuse was told again. Yes, there were restaurants closeby that my boyfriend and I could have gone to but when you're in the mood to dine-in it is kind of a let down. Lastly, the bed was no where near being comfortable, I had 3 sleepless nights; the bed seemed really old and sunken in.

Reviews.Title: “Modest But Completely Satisfying”
Reviews.Author: Canadatom1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kutuma is situated on a busy portion of Rue St.Denis. Busy in that your options for shopping, dining, drinking coffee, wine, beer & hot chocolate are at your door step. Rooms are well equipped with kitchen facilities, a spacious setting, a very clean bath room and comfortable bed. Don't expect fancy concierge service, a gym or mini bar. They are however very friendly and gracious. We have stayed at Hotel Kutuma three times and have been very satisfied with our comfort and care on each visit. They provide valet parking for $15 and you can easily walk to many of the interesting venues in the neighbourhood. L'Express Restaurant, a favourite for years is virtually across the street and it will provide that perfect bistro evening.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Amelie-Mellow
Reviews.Content: I found Kutuma by pure chance- it was a popular weekend in Montreal and this was one of the few hotels available that fit the bill. Driving up to the hotel it is completely unassuming, even the check in is simple, however, once you enter the rooms it's like a completely different place. The rooms are spacious, have a small living room, kitchenette, comfortable bed and nice bathroom with tub. Other than the rooms being great and the location being super accessible what sets this place a part is the service. The staff there are extremely accommodating going over and above to ensure guests have a great experience. The location is perfect, it is very central however not in the usual touristy spot which means it's not noisy. It's up the street from the most fantastic Boulanger which is great for a quick croissant and pain au chocolat to start the day of right. I would absolutely recommend this boutique hotel for anyone wanting something unique and special.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: Toronto G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on the reviews of TripAdvisor. This hotel was not bad, far from it, however it also wasn't an amazing hotel either. I stayed in one of their suites with the full kitchen and living room. Bed was comfortable (soft mattress), with a lot of pillows. It had a very good location being on St. Denis, however it was a couple of blocks away from where a lot of things happen. In the summer, this isn't an issue, in the Montreal winter, you will probably be taking a cab. Breakfast started at 8am, but as I had to leave before 8am, they were gracious enough to provide me with continental breakfast the night before. The shower/jacuzzi that they had was nice to look at, but actually left water all over the place. Valet service was fast and they all the staff were friendly. The place wasn't dusty per se, but it wasn't the cleanest suite I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A small gem in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Jessie Boy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a weekend in Montreal. We stayed at the Hotel Kutuma, on Rue St. Denis. It is a warm and beautiful boutique hotel. The room was much bigger than a normal hotel room and the service was warm and helpful. It is quieter and not in the middle of the tourist noise. We hope to be back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: filmgirl325
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I just got back from a three day trip in Montreal, and had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Kutuma. It's a small, boutique style hotel, but you wouldn't know that by looking at the rooms. They are enormous and have every amenity you could think of. Between the gigantic bathtub, the fully stocked kitchen (microwave, fridge, stove, pots, pans, utensils, etc.) dining nook, and comfy bed, I barely wanted to leave the room at all. It was wonderful waking up and being able to make delicious espresso in the Keruig style espresso machine in the room. Everything we needed was available to us. We forgot toothpaste, but were thrilled to find individually wrapped toothbrushes and toothpastes waiting for us in the bathroom. And enjoying a bottle of wine was easy with a wine opener and set of wine glasses right there in the room. There was even a lovely little balcony, although it was a bit too cold too enjoy this time of year. For a hundred dollars a night, I can't believe how luxurious the room was. I kept telling my fiance, why would anyone want to stay anywhere else? The hotel is situated on a street full of shops and restaurants, and very close to the metro, so getting around is a breeze and there is plenty to explore. After walking around all day it was a wonderful place to come back to and relax. We didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurant attached to the hotel, but it seemed like a nice place. The valet parking was 15 dollars a day which I thought was pretty reasonable, and the staff was very friendly. If you're ever in Montreal I couldn't recommend this place more!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at Hotel Kutuma!”
Reviews.Author: Diana R
Reviews.Content: We recently flew to Montreal for a long weekend to celebrate our anniversary and to visit our daughter, a student at McGill. The staff at the hotel were fabulous, very courteous and helpful. The hotel is conveniently located near the metro and bus stops, but is also located in a neighborhood perfect for exploring on foot. Rooms are spacious, comfortable beds. The restaurant next to the hotel offered delicious food. We would recommend Hotel Kutuma to anyone traveling to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Shobana R
Reviews.Content: We loved the location,the rooms and the food. It is way way better than any of the regular big hotels / chains - which cost approximately the same or more. The location is very good for tourists. We especially liked the cafes nearby. Very good service and there is valet parking facility. But please note that there is no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy B
Reviews.Content: We love the Hotel Kutuma..great location & the rooms are awesome. One of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed at; highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ianphilip112
Reviews.Content: To be perfectly honest, I have never in my entire life taken the time to write a hotel review but I want to share with all the travelers to Montreal that without question, Hotel Kutuma should be everyone's hotel of choice. People always mistakenly book with the national outfits like W, The Fairmont, Sheraton, and Delta because its like going to McDonalds - you know the price and what to expect and ultimately are disapointed - but to all travelers, I want to strongly recommend Hotel Kutuma. It is the best located hotel in all of Montreal - on famed St. Denis Street, in the heart of Plateau and walking distance to all the chic restaurants, bars, cafes, clubs, lounges. The rooms are so beautifully decorated. Each room has extras, and amenities that are a travelers dream (they actually have good espresso coffee machines in each room). The price point is more competitive vs. the national outfits. The staff are unbelievable... at your beck and call... no matter what the request or what time it is. Because of its smaller size, and boutique feel, you are treated like not only the most important guest, but like royalty. I would also recommend eating at the restaurant below - one of Montreal most famous restaurants...My only complaint about this hotel is that it is only in Montreal, and not any other cities.... A Strong recommend from a hotel aficionado.

Reviews.Title: “Euro-style quirky and mostly good experience”
Reviews.Author: ChillinGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a conference with our 3 month old son. Overall our experience was good, but we would not recommend the hotel for those with babies or small children. The location is excellent - far enough up St. Denis to avoid the noise but close enough to walk both there as well as in the other direction to less crowded restaurants and shops. Checking in and out: this is quite simply awkward. Here's where the quirky part comes in :). While the service is very good, if you have a baby or small children and a lot of stuff, you have to unload it on the curb, get it into a micro-sized lobby, and then take it up stairs (no elevator). If you are just on your own it is probably fine, but the stairs were hard with a baby (long flight to get up and down), especially with a buggy (which they were happy to store for us, but imagine having to call the front desk for your buggy every time you step out of the hotel). Also, you have to use the valet service, as there's nowhere to park, and this can take a long time. Service was very inconsistent with this, which is a pain. Lastly, when we checked out, they gave us no receipt! My husband didn't realize that I needed this for my company reimbursement, so I emailed them for one later. When it came it was not itemized! Just a total with tax broken down - very inconvenient, and I think unprofessionaly (and hard for reimbursement purposes). Room: much smaller than the website suggests. Having not been in Montreal for over 10 years, I cannot comment on comparables, but this felt like Manhattan sizes. You know those cool, slightly more affordable hotels in Manhattan where they suspend the TV from the ceiling because of no space? It was minimally better than that. Having said that, they did manage to squeeze in the necessities - comfortable king bed, nice living area, interesting and cute furnishings in the African theme, and lovely bathroom with gorgeous jetted tub and shower. The only peculiarity was that the kitchenette was made from cheap IKEA stuff you'd see in a dorm room. No biggie, but not what I'd expect in a hotel. Food: we love Ethiopian, but just due to circumstances we did not actually eat it while there in their restaurant. We did, however, order their breakfast and it was excellent. TIP: great for two, so you might want to order one breakie and share. Service: except for the valet delay and the lack of receipt, everyone was extremely helpful and courteous, and we experienced very good service. Summary: If I did not have a child I'd return, but I'd want to check out comparables before committing to that. According to many, accomodations in Montreal have slipped quite a bit in the last 10-20 years, so maybe this is much better for the money than I am reporting. But all in all, a great location, comfortabel room and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: JBrodie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Kutuma during what was predominantly a three-week tour of the East Coast of America, and boy, was the room and its facilities a sight for sore eyes after back-to-back travelling and eating out constantly. We were thrilled to bits by the kitchenette and fairly close proximity (10-12 minute walk) to a decent supermarket (on Saint Laurent), and happily made a couple of breakfasts and easy pasta/wine suppers while we were there. We definitely made the best of our little dining room, which, with its pre-set table and candles, was lovely and romantic. The Kutuma offers the best of both worlds: good facilities for doing self-catering, and a top location if you fancy a short stroll to eat out. There was an array of wonderful looking eateries -and a nice bakery- within 100 metres, not to mention the Ethiopian restaurant downstairs, at which we enjoyed a really tasty and different meal. The staff at the Kutuma were so accommodating and, from whisking our far-too-heavy suitcases upstairs with a flourish on day one, looked after us brilliantly (even popping up to our room discreetly to leave a lovely dessert when we couldn't manage one in the restaurant!). My partner and I said we would recommend this place to everyone and certainly return there ourselves should we ever be lucky enough to revisit Montreal. There's no denying that it's quite an expensive place to stay, but equally, we felt that our stay here was money well spent. A great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spence44
Reviews.Content: The location is great for a visit to the city, near lots of restaurants. The African themed decor is classy and elegant. The rooms have many nice touches (we looked at a few), and are spotless. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, contemporary small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Susanrr2
Reviews.Content: Kutuma evidently means "Welcome" and it is well-named. The rooms are large with contemporary decor and a usable small kitchen. There is a great Ethiopian restaurant on the first floor that is affiliated with the hotel. Staff was extremely helpful, including directions and information about events. The hotel is convenient to the Old Port and other attractions, expecially using the Metro, and at the same time is in a non-touristy neighborhood that was very pleasant and interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RosebankT
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Very spacious and comfortable rooms with all mod cons. Conveniently located near metro and hip St Denis restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AimeeCorinne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Kutuma for one night over Labor Day weekend. I didn't warn my husband about the safari themed decor and he was a little confused when we first arrived... but overall we had a wonderful stay. Pros: -Great location: lots of restaurants, bars, and shops on Rue St. Denis. About a 20 minute walk to Old Montreal. -Very reasonable! We paid $100 plus tax! -Kitchenette in room: mini fridge, coffee/espresso machine, dishes, stove top. If you were staying for several days it would be great to save some money on meals. - Clean, updated bathrooms - Very friendly staff Cons: - Can hear floors creaking above you and people in hallway/stairway

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...”
Reviews.Author: Richard P
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in late July. This hotel was nicely decorated with an African theme. The full kitchen included a full-sized microwave. The bathroom was nice, with a big tub and candles, but the fixtures were a bit flimsy. The mattress was excellent (This was first of nine hotels on a long trip!) The location was a block from the Metro station, and still relatively close to downtown. Lots of restaurants nearby, including an African restaurant in the hotel. The only drawback was being assigned a room on the fourth floor and having NO ELEVATOR! I don't think anything on the website or Trip Advisor says that, and trudging up and down those stairs with the luggage was hard work!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, amazing location, but a bit heavy on the leopard print”
Reviews.Author: travel2live2travel
Reviews.Content: Private, intimate, spacious, and highly themed. Our room had: - a giant bed (high off the ground) with a mountain of gold, brown, zebra, and leopard pillows. - a fully set table for two - a modern and full-service kitchen - a big bathtub (candles and fake palm tree included) - mood lighting galore! This would be an ideal set-up if you wanted to stay in and cook your meals either to save some money or have even more alone-time. We really enjoyed it and found the service to be really helpful. Past midnight, the man at the desk helped us brainstorm all the options we had for getting to the airport the next day. Also, they even stored our bikes in their basement so they wouldn't get wet! There is an Ethiopian restaurant co-owned and connected to the hotel downstairs if you want a convenient and equally-romantic meal during your stay. The area is safe and very fun to explore by bike (read more about area below.) St.Denis: This nice boutique hotel is up the hill on St. Denis, one of the most hip streets in Montreal. You won't find much about this street in your guidebooks, and for good reason, the locals want to keep this little gem to themselves. The bottom part of St.Denis is a bit cheesy and commercial, but once you reach Kutuma and up, it's really amazing the side of Montreal you discover: haute cuisine, bohemian hidden cafes, non-touristic shopping, bike paths, parks and more!

Reviews.Title: “we thought it was fabulous and would come back any time”
Reviews.Author: mrstweet
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived, the hotel staff were as helpful as any people could have been!!! They helped us bring all of our luggage up the 3 flights of steps to our room, they were responsive to all of our needs, they stored our bikes for us, they parked our car for us, etc.............The restaurant downstairs, Ethiopian, was excellent and our meal was very pleasant. The room was very comfortable, well equipped, the bathroom was beautiful, the place was really clean. The supplied us w/ everything in the kitchen area and even toothbrushes and toothpaste. I can't say enough good things about our stay and would love to come back ASAP. The neighborhood is great too - right in the middle of the Latin Quarter - and accessible to many bars, restaurants, and great shopping. One block from the Metro too, so you can get anywhere you need to in the city from here.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: manswa
Reviews.Content: What a welcome - we arrived early (1pm), well ahead of the advertised check-in time (4pm) but this was not a problem. We were greeted, checked in and although our room was not ready for us to use our bags were stored and were in our room when we returned later in the afternoon. This is a small 9 room boutique hotel; our room was beautiful - very comfortable and well equipped with cooking facilities in addition to a separate seating area. The front desk staff were incredibly polite and helpful on check in and check out. We had breakfast on the patio in the adjoining Blue Nile Restaurant (Ethiopian cuisine) - a very good breakfast with an Ethiopian twist. The location of this hotel is very good with a good variety of shops and restaurants nearby - the Metro is two blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back and stay at Kutuma!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJoeMo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel after seeing some fun reviews on TA and after getting a very good rate for a Sunday night through Expedia. We were extremely impressed with the value of this hotel. We showed up around 1 PM and our room wasn't ready yet, but they were kind enough to store our bags for us until we returned later. We returned to our room (#303) to find a huge suite, complete with balcony, sitting area with table (set with dishes, wine glasses, and cutlery), a mini kitchen with stove top, microwave, fridge, coffee maker, espresso maker (which makes great espresso!), and sink! Then, separated by a half wall was our safari animal-clad bed and sleeping area. Beyond that was the huge and well-appointed bathroom with big bath tub / shower. The room and hotel in general were so clean, nice, and well decorated. They must have put a lot of money into this place to get it so perfect. We really can't believe the value we got for $142. In addition to all of that, the location right on St. Denis at the edge of Plateau is perfect. We rode Bixi bikes all weekend and there were two Bixi stops right by the hotel. Heaps of restaurants, shops, and cafes on the street and on all of the side streets. There is an Ethiopian restaurant, Nile Bleu, in the hotel. It looked great, but we didn't get a chance to eat there unfortunately. This is only the third hotel we have stayed in in Montreal, but we know that there is nowhere else we will ever stay. So great in every aspect! Don't be intimidated by the safari theme and leopard sheets. Embrace it and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and convenient boutiquey hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregg19
Reviews.Content: The best about this hotel is the location, right between the Latin Quarter and the Plateau Mont Royale. There is an amazing bakery right next to it, absolutely worth trying (Mamie Clafoutis). Very safe area with people around 24-7. The bathroom was large, there is a small kitchenette in the room. We didn't have a great view from window but that was fine. We didn't experience any bad noise. The staff was great and attentive, except that sometimes they are very busy. The downstairs restaurant was hopping though we didn't eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Last Minute Find”
Reviews.Author: cwilker10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a last minute trip to Montreal and didn't find a hotel till the night of our trip. Calling around we found that Hotel Kutuma had vacancy for Friday and Saturday night. We weren't expecting much since it was so last minute, but we were pleasantly surprised. The room was large with a full kitchen and the bathroom contained a whirlpool tub. The location allowed us to walk down St. Denis and see all of the interesting restaurants and bars. One interesting aspect was that our car was parked off-site and had to be retrieved when we wanted it. This was not that big of a deal except that they picked up the wrong car and we were watching from our window. Once we went down to find out what was taking so long to get our car the error was discovered and our car was promptly retrieved. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel, but like another poster couldn't get the coffee machine to work either.

Reviews.Title: “cannot fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: carvingqueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in room 303 for two days and we both loved it! In a nutshell: staff during check in at check out VERY friendly, comfortable bed and cushions, lovely bathroom (with candles next to the bathtub should you wish to have a romantic bath), fridge, microwave, kettle, espresso AND separate coffee maker (coffee powder, tea and espresso capsules provided), cutlery, crockery, small dining area with low table and chairs, nice TV. As another reviewer said: Yes, you can here the people in the room above walking, but it is really not that loud and it certainly did not disturb our sleep. In general we found the room actually very quiet. Another reviewer complained about the room being dark - ?? - open the blinds and turn on the lights for heaven's sake! We thought the lighting system in the room was amazing - with dimmers to adjust to your every mood. If my husband had a complaint, then it was about the towels - he would have liked proper large sized bath towels. In his mind bigger towels would make this hotel the best he has ever been to (in my mind the Hilton at Canary Wharf, London is maybe a bit better) PS: there is an Ethopian restaurant at the bottom of the hotel - we didn't try this one, but have had Ethopian food twice before (both other restaurants also called Blue Nile;-) and it was really good.

Reviews.Title: “OK - a few quirky points”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: It does not look great from the outside - put me off a bit. Small hotel, small lobby but good staff on duty who checked me in fine. Its all in an African style - different, if you want African in a Canadian winter. Good size room kitchen unit, cutlery and crockery. A nice couch to sit on. My room 293 was at the back - so nice and quiet, no real view at all but I liked the quiet. Downsides - a few details: Bath water runs slowly. Nice very deep bath, but takes a long time to fill. The only way that I could drain the bath was to wedge a spoon under the plug. Toilet will flush forever - needs the rubber bung re-doing. Fridge in the room - nice, but it will make some noise. Coffeemachine _ I read all the instructions and called reception who looked at it, we could not fill it with water. (amend instructions, please!) Cupboard (see photo) is very short. Cannot hang any long items, coats, etc!

Reviews.Title: “Practicality, luxury, and personality on the fabulous St. Denis”
Reviews.Author: Jenny0386
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a birthday celebration with a friend. Upon approaching the hotel, it is rather unassuming. I was greeted by very friendly staff as well as a free room upgrade for a previous minor inconvenience prior to arrival. The room itself was fabulous, with a well equipped kitchenette, roomy bathroom, seating and dining area, and not to forget the supremely comfortable bed, I could have stayed in the room for most of my trip! It was really a great place to retire to after long days of sight-seeing and walking about town. The kitchenette was really more of a full kitchen with a full sized refrigerator and was ideal for preparing early morning/or late morning breakfasts and late night snacks or drinks. The hotel has a wonderful Ethiopian food restaurant on the first floor (to go with it's Ethiopian themed decor!). Having never experienced Ethiopian food before, it was quite phenomenal, especially after a 7+ hour drive to Montreal! I chose to have valet service because I did bring my car, the staff took good care of it as parking can be difficult on St. Denis, and it really made a difference not having to struggle to find a parking spot especially in a city that is not my own. The rooms were clean, and as mentioned before - Ethiopian themed. The linens were changed daily and bathroom toiletries restocked as well. The only areas of improvement for the rooms would be the minimal space in which to store packed items (only one closet and no drawers), but there was plenty of room for my suitcase. The TV was rather small and I was not able to order any movies, but that was a good thing because there was plenty to do and plenty to see in walking distance in such a good area of St. Denis street. This hotel was an ideal location for a leisure trip to Montreal, I was close to great nightlife, food, and shopping. Having stayed only three nights, I could have stayed much longer and had plenty to do and explore. I would certainly recommend this hotel to others, it is a comfortable and quiet place to retreat after a full day of sights and fun in Montreal, I hope I can return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBSK417
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in dozens of hotels in Montreal, of all sizes and ratings. I was extremely satisfied with the Kutuma. I arrived very late, and the staff were unusually welcoming and pleasant. They had upgraded me to a higher class of room without my asking, because it was empty. The room itself - maybe not to everyone's taste, a lot of faux-African accents - was large, very comfortable, quiet and clean. The location is convenient for many as well, right on Rue St. Denis near Sherbrooke, easy access to shopping and dining on the Plateau or business/entertainment downtown. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: srtacoche
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Montreal for 2 nights in July, during the heat wave and the last day of the Jazz Festival. The room was a cool respite after walking around during the day. I don't particularly like animal print decor, but the comfort of the bed and the room in general made up for it. The room was quiet and dark (at night). We particularly enjoyed that the room was equipped with a refrigerator, sink, coffeemaker, and dishware. It was nice to be able to make good coffee from the comfort of our room. Service was friendly, but not overbearing. The hotel is located within blocks of a lot of great restaurants and the metro, where we rented the Bici bikes to get around more easily. A wonderful place to stay in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: sadiefla
Reviews.Content: Though the animal prints are a little kitschy, this hotel was definitely a great value. Only about 2 blocks from the metro station (very convenient in 10 degree F weather) and walking distance to many shops and restaurants. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. The continental breakfast was more than listed ($9 rather than $7), but was delicious and prepared on the spot (not sitting out for hours like it would be at a chain hotel). We did not eat at the restaurant for dinner but did stop in for a late dessert...and once our waiter found out we were also hotel guests, he gave us the dessert for free. Room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. Nice alternative to a chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: max3a
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Kutuma over a long weekend in early Dec. The quality of everything was first class. Room, staff, and location ( short walk to Sherbrooke Metro) plus close by to shops, bistro's etc. I did not eat at their Blue Nile but it seemed busy all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Sadiemoon
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable and spacious suite (room 303) with a balcony - so my boyfriend could go out for a smoke. We slept very well on the large queen bed. The room had a fridge, microwave, stovetop, toaster, kitchen sink, capuccino machine and coffee maker. There was a nice sitting area with a safe and free wifi. The bathroom was very large with a nice deep tub and shower head with a good spray. When I first saw the pictures for the hotel I thought the decor might be over the top. But it isn't at all - understated main decor with interesting African inspired accents. This is especially evident in the main floor Ethiopian restaurant - Very nice waterfall wall, comfortable and understated elegant ambiance. The food was very good. Service at the front desk and wait staff was excellent. The young man who answered the phone when we called a couple of weeks prior was the same guy who checked us in. We had asked him to go to Notre Dame Basilica and pick up some tickets to the Christmas Eve mass - he did - and was very cheery when we met him - nice touch for service! The only thing I would say is the wavy glass on the bathroom door didn't conceal really well - and we would have been more comfortable if there could have been more privacy to the person sitting on the toilet from the other sitting in the bedroom! Excellent value, exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - what an experience!”
Reviews.Author: PinkySwear
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! We stayed for 3 nights in a deluxe suite. As soon as we arrived a large pot of tea was bought to our room. The service continued in this way - when we went downstairs in the morning we were offered breakfast - nice and varied, a perfect start to the day. Even when we went to collect our bags before leaving, we had a little while to wait until our taxi arrived so we were given more drinks, for free. The service was impeccable. I would recommend the restaurant downstairs as well - very different to anything I have tasted before, but really tasty and it shows - it was full up every night we were there (which was mid-week). The room was lovely - really big, comfy bed, sofas and a well equipped kitchenette - very good for me as I like to be able to have tea and coffee when I want! The bathroom was nice too - candles by the (huge) bath was a nice touch. Free internet too - always a plus from my point of view. We heard a little bit of noise from the road outside but no noise from the restaurant downstairs. It was also well within our budget for the trip. Close to a subway station and reasonably easy to find a taxi from outside. If we go back to Montreal, we will definitely be going back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and unique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tromboner
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Kutuma is a unique hotel because of its beautiful and exotic decor. The pictures on the hotel's website are an accurate depiction of the jungle-themed (but not childish) rooms. We were upgraded to a suite with a double whirlpool and overhead shower heads and a fully equipped kitchen. The location and staff were great. I can't imagine that we would stay anywhere else on future visits to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive surprise”
Reviews.Author: travelproch
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay at this cosy small hotel and can only recommend it. I got one of the main street facing large room with jacuzzi, kitchenette and comfortable sofas. Staff is friendly and helpfull if you need anything. The continental breakfast is also more than just a piece of toast and some jam.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: notravelbug
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was staying in someone else's apartment as opposed to a better hotel room. The decor is all african which is cool but it was long over due for an update or freshening up. There are 9 rooms in the hotel in total and my colleague's room was on the fourth floor....no elevator. I would not stay at this hotel again although the area was great.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value -- five star gem”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaOttawa
Reviews.Content: other than the stair case to get to the room, excellent value for the quality -- great room with kitchenette and living area -- top reno and cosy a little outside centre town but worth the detour excellent food and service

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully located, charming hotel with 5-star staff !”
Reviews.Author: LATVevey
Reviews.Content: Greatly located in the liveliest neighbourhood of Montreal, surrounded by shops, cool bars and restaurants. It is a charming 3-star hotel that is perfectly kept, and offers a service level worth of a 5-star hotel ! The staff is discrete, but really kind and welcoming. Without overdoing it, they are always helpful and make you feel like special guests. Rooms are full of little attentions and spacious. Dinner is wonderful at the Ethiopian restaurant downstairs. We almost felt like not publishing this review â€¦ just to keep this little gem to ourselves ! But this hotel and its staff do truly deserve the best of reviews.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: ExtremSports
Reviews.Content: After my treasure hunt of a time on the net, trip advisor gave me some interesting possibilities on places to stay! Kutuma won hands down! Reserving online was simple and hassle free! My wife was overjoyed to finally be in montreal after so many years! Our first impressions were met without a doubt! From the courteous welcoming of the staff to the room service every morning with a delicious breakfast! We even had an expresso machine in the room! Wow! Our stay was amazing. Our room was fantastic. Thank you for the free lift to the Old Port to see the Cirque du Soleil... Absolutely amazing! A must see! The museums are right around the neighborhood! Everything seems to be a footstep away with the nearest subway just around the corner, which takes you all around the city! Shopping, restaurants & all the nightlife excitement anyone can ask for! We were right in the heart of all the action! Mount Royal Park, the Latin Quarters, St-Denis street, greenery everywhere we looked! Downstairs, the Ethiopean restaurant was deliciously finger licking good! There is also a french restaurant not too far called the Express that is recommended by the hotel! It was great! Thank you Katuma! We'll certainly be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Things You Need To Know About Kutuma”
Reviews.Author: frygirl9288
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 302 for four nights. This was classified as their "Superior Queen" room, the smallest option since I was traveling by myself. Here is an objective list of items (both good and bad) I wish I'd known before booking this room: (1) NOISE ISSUES. The hotel has 4 floors of rooms, and room 302 is on the 3rd (not top) floor. I could hear every footstep of the party above me, particularly when they came home at 2am. Mind you, these people weren't partying and jumping. Just walking around getting ready for bed. It was loud enough to disturb my sleep and I didn't care for it at all. I could also hear the people in room 301 adjacent to me. There must have been a closet door on the shared wall between our rooms because they would slam it and it would shake my bed. I actually scooted my bed away from the wall to try to not be disturbed by it. I requested to be moved to a room on the top floor but unfortunately they were booked solid during my stay. I absolutely wouldn't stay at this hotel again unless they could guarantee me a room on the top floor and then the sound between adjacent rooms would be a crap shoot at that point. (2) AIRPORT SHUTTLE. They offer a courtesy shuttle to the airport. I didn't know this until I was checking out and asked them to call me a cab. They said their shuttle had just left and the next one wouldn't be for 2 hours. He scolded me for not reserving the shuttle 24 hours in advance. How the heck do you schedule something you don't know exists? That really irked me as I wasted a lot of money on cab rides to/from the airport. Very frustrating, especially since I was cranky from lack of sleep due to overhead footstep noise. (3) SHABBY ROOMS. The rooms are a bit shabby. Nobody seems to mention that in their reviews. This hotel is priced accordingly so I wasn't too disappointed, but they show their wear and tear. I definitely wouldn't book this place for a romantic weekend. It's just not up to that caliber. But for a convenient place to stay, then probably. (4) COFFEE STATION. The kitchenette in my room had both a drip coffee pot and an espresso machine. The hotel provided coffee, although I had to ask the maid service to refill the espresso coffee for me as they didn't do it otherwise. The espresso machine only worked half the time I tried, but when it did it was nice to have. (5) DARK ROOM. My room faced a fire escape away from the street side, so upon first entering, I thought it didn't have any windows at all. Upon closer inspection, there was a tiny window in the kitchenette area that had a blackout blind on it, and the bathroom had a much larger window for light. So it felt a bit like staying in a dungeon, but the upside was that the room was extremely dark at night which aided in sleeping (when people weren't walking overhead or slamming doors). Overall, I'll be shopping for an alternate place to stay the next time I visit Montreal. All the noise that carries through the walls and floors made it feel like staying in a tenement.

Reviews.Title: “A low key gem”
Reviews.Author: wombat23
Reviews.Content: I chose Kutuma for an anniversary weekend away. We are fans of value, independence and quirky charm, and it had been over 97 months since my wife and I had spent a night without a child under the same roof, so I wanted something luxurious that also fit our tastes. Hotel Kutuma delivered in almost all ways, and I have debated 5 or 4 stars, leaning finally to the former because the excellent service made up for any technical deficiencies. Those deficiencies included an espresso machine that did not work (and they knew this but left it in room to my chagrin after mucking about for 1/2 an hour) and small items on room makeup. The website shows off the high end rooms, so our Junior Suite was initially a slight disappointment for me. But my (design-oriented) partner immediately loved it and I realized I had scored: The room was very nice and well worth the price. The location is great and the staff were really efficient and friendly. We ate in the hotel's Nil Bleu Ethiopian restaurant one of our nights and enjoyed our meal thoroughly. Recognizing us as guests (?) they even sent some complimentary dessert and coffee, even though the restaurant was thronging and we had no reservations. They made us feel very welcome, and with the feel of a tiny boutique hotel it made for an excellent weekend. We'll stay at Hotel Kutuma again if we visit as a couple. We would probably favour Square Phillips for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Very well looked after, great location”
Reviews.Author: AgedStudent
Reviews.Content: A group of us were over for a family wedding, and the hotel was ideal. Our rooms were large enough and well equipped (apart from hanging space for formal wear - only short wardrobes). There was a mini-kitchen, beds were large and comfortable and bathrooms sumptuous. The gentleman behind reception was friendy, keen and very good at trying to resolve any queries. We worried about noise from the restaurant on the ground floor but it was fine. The restaurant is also very good and popular. Not far to the metro, bus or just stroll either way along Rue St Denis. Downsides? The stairs are steep and there is no lift so I wouldn't recommend for anyone with limited mobility. Also one day we came in at midday and were politely asked to stay out till the rooms were cleaned. We pointed out we had to change for a wedding and would be gone well before the cleaning finished - rota was rearranged and all was well, but not quite what you expect in an hotel. Overall though a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: simonkantor
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kutuma provided us with a wonderful stay. The staff were charming and caring; their hospitality really made our trip. When we imposed on them by passing a rainy hour before our airport run in the hotel restaurant, we were showered with food and drink. The room was unique; clad in animal print design and absurdly large! The bed was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality, good value - really felt at home”
Reviews.Author: ChesterWhite
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in late December. Despite the cold the Kutuma management gave us a warm welcome being gracious, helpful and attentive. Rooms showed considerable attention to detail both in terms of decor and amenities. Located minutes from a Metro stop, the hotel is in an area that has a neighborhood feel with a variety of good restaurants and convenience stores. The in-house restaurant, Le Nil Bleu, also has great service as well as excellent food. We'd definitely book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wild African decor in Montreal, Quebec!”
Reviews.Author: Basil53
Reviews.Content: This place was a ton of fun! The African decor was whimsical yet tasteful. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom had all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Always excellent and always getting better!”
Reviews.Author: NHRuff
Reviews.Content: Kutuma Hotel is a wonderful place to stay! The owners and staff all work to see that every need is met. Rooms are spacious & clean, and the beds are sooooo comfortable. Bottled water and coffee are both provided in the room at no charge. Convenient in-room kitchenettes. Fantastic location for nightlife & shopping. The Blue Nile Restaurant is downstairs and owned by the same people. Delicious Ethiopian food!!!! Love the mamayo (sp?) specialty drink, but they have a great wine list as well. We have stayed here several times over the years and each time we come back, they have found new ways to improve things, always working to make each stay even better!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, jungle themed rooms!”
Reviews.Author: rose77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I read the reviews of Hotel Kutuma on a few different sites before booking, but somehow we managed to miss the fact that it is jungle-themed! When we walked into our room (a Junior Suite) the first thing we saw was a king-sized bed decked out in zebra and leopard print bedding, and then the fake palm tree and African carvings. But after being caught off guard by the kitsch factor we warmed up to it. Our room was very comfortable and clean. The location was good for walking to many different neighborhoods and the staff was pleasant and accommodating (they let us check out 2 hours late). I'm not giving Kutuma 5 stars, however, because the microwave and mini stovetop didn't work, and the deep, luxurious-looking bathtub took forever to fill.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! This place is a total gem!”
Reviews.Author: kjai
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kutuma is the nicest place I have ever stayed! My experiance even tops staying in the Romeo and Juliet suite at sandals where I had a private butler! The staff were so kind, and yet down to earth. When I arrived they promptly checked me in, offered me a drink, and brought my bags up to my room. The decor was awesome, totally my style, top to bottom. The bed was super comfy and the sheets were not only great to look at, they were super comfy too! The hotel was so clean, it was if no one had ever stayed in that room before. My only complaint was that the water pressure was not excellent, but i stayed on the top floor and it would likely be better on the lower floors. I would not only recomend this hotel to others, I plan on writing an article about it. It has opened my eyes to the benefits of boutique hotels over the big chains. Kudos to you Hotel Kutuma! Keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: adamminneapolis
Reviews.Content: i dont normally write reviews, actually i never have, but felt i had to for hotel kutuma. my wife and i spent 4 days in montreal for a quick vacation and stayed here. when we arrived, we were offered a complimentary drink and upgraded to a suite with a jacuzzi. very cool. the room was huge, bathroom was huge, full kitchen with appliances nicer than most peoples homes, exposed brick, electric fireplace that is kind of cheesy but actually kind of nice, king size bed with amazing down comforter and linens. i cant say enough about the concierge, although they weren't around all the time (which isn't necessarily a bad thing) they were extremely helpful and friendly when they were. the location is absolutely perfect, close to everything, restaurants (although there seems to be a restaurant every other store front in the entire city!)and shopping. we also ate at the restaurant in the hotel, the blue nile, and it was great Ethiopian food. If you are alright staying at a non-chain, boutique hotel, then i cant recommend this place enough, you wont be let down.

Reviews.Title: “Bum Deal”
Reviews.Author: trav4ever
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the entrance was not clear. The reception was just just enough for two people. Two flights of stairs to our room with two suitcases. The room was tiny. The wardrobe was a joke. The bathroom was small. A small area of carpet between the fridge and bed was wet. We pointed this out to the manager there and then. Said it would be sorted. No one came that night to fix the problem. The bed was too high and soft. Before going out next day we again mentioned the damp carpet. On returning to our room at the end of the day sight seeing. The damp patch was still there. Once again mentioned to reception. Yes, later that evening a man came into the room and declared the fridge was leaking. About 20 minutes later the problem was fixed. This could have been fixed while we where out for the day, instead of us having to hang around in the room waiting for the man to go before we could shower and relax for the night. The next day we were to book out and decided to have breakfast. Not the best, it was just fried potatoes and veggies no meat no eggs - strange. Left feeling hungry. We have stayed at lots of hotels and this was not the best. I don't understand the write ups. Yes, it was clean. But not excellent..

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, clean, well-located”
Reviews.Author: spanish_af
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay. We actually didn't have any interaction with the staff except for checking in where we were offerred a complimentary drink. It seemed to us more like renting an apartment for a few days. We paid in advance and just left the keys in the room as we left as there also seemed to be no one around. This isn't a complaint though, that was fine. The room was on the second floor, large, clean, with kitchen and dining area. Not many windows but a door to a fire escape. The African theme was interesting. It was very quiet during our stay, we didn't hear any traffic noise or noise from other rooms. It was nice to have a refrigerator to put snacks in. The hotel is only a few blocks from the Sherbrooke metro and there are dozens and dozens of restaurants within a few blocks. We love Ethiopian food and enjoyed eating at the restaurant downstairs which seemed very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and funky rooms....”
Reviews.Author: Ssimerad
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Kutuma recently and felt absolutely spoiled by the management and staff of the hotel and restaurant. Any requests we made were promptly granted and always with a gracious smile. The hotel itself is in a lovely shopping area and jammed full of ethnic restaurants and interesting cafes/bars. The decor is funky and makes the stay all the more interesting. The bathroom was large and the jetted tub very invitiing. We ate at the Blue Nile restaurant which is directly attached to the hotel and enjoyed the experience of trying a new style of food and eating with our hands. Beware the complimentary desserts...they are delicious! Couldn't think of a better location in Montreal to stay and along with the charm of a smaller hotel and the attentiveness of the staff, Kutuma is definitely worth a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “nicest spot in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Jessie Boy
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. The staff was pleasant and extremely helpful. They went out their way to make sure my wife and I had everything we needed. We ordered Ethiopian food from the restaurant downstairs for room service. The food was excellent. The location is great. Right near a metro station and close walking distance to anything you might want to do in Montreal. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Unique Hotel in Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: ERSPDX
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Kutuma, highlighted by the friendly service, comfortable bed and sitting area, and the best bathroom. Got there early and was unable to get in to our room. In the meantime, we were treated to a complimentary, delicious cup of coffee. We were able to leave them our luggage and car, and went off to explore the city on foot and Metro (stop a bit of a walk, but nothing too bad). When we returned our luggage was in our room. The king sized bed was soooo comfortable, but the highlight was the bathroom. There was a huge deep tub with this great showerhead that adjusted to your height, and side panels featuring additional water jets. Very cool. I can't say enough how nice the proprietor was, and I had a great time wandering around the surrounding neighborhood. In fact a few blocks down there is a street closed to traffic, with numerous bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: webbermishoe
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Kutuma. The hospitality was wonderful. The manager was so gracious. The hotel is near all festivals. There is no need for a bus or cab unless you don't like walking. It is minutes away from downtown and located on St. Denis street which is a trendy, old world charm, and a bohemian type of place. The Ethiopian Restaurant in the hotel was wonderful. Try the Combination Platter #2. My only complaint is the taxes for the hotel and Montreal for that matter. Very expensive and this is coming from someone who lives in Chicago where we have the highest sales tax in the US at almost 11%. Must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Kutuma is a little jewel in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: killbob
Reviews.Content: WOW. Honestly, wow! My husband and I stayed in Kutuma just last month and we were so very pleased. It's not often that you get to really enjoy what it feels like to be welcomed somewhere ( when traveling) with true care and concern of your well being and enjoyment. Kutuma is a little jewel of a hotel that is located on one of the THE best streets in Montreal ( Rue St. Denis). You have everything you could need at your doorstep - - such a quaint little park next door and the metro two blocks over plus wonderful shops, restaurants and beautiful streets. The best, most outstanding highlights of Kutuma: The Staff: they greet you at the door and carry your bags up to your room, they are very personable and will go to very far extremes to help you with your stay. On leaving the hotel, the owner personally packed our car with our luggage in the pouring rain! The Hotel: Kutuma has a very unique style. Our room was a junior suite - - honestly, it was the most comfortable stay I've ever spent in a hotel. The bed was FANTASTIC! The bathroom ( shower! ) was very unique in style. We had our own little kitchenette and sitting area, as well. The touches that were put in to the room made it a very memorable stay. Also, you could hear no one! The hotel must be built very soundly - - it was like you were in your own little cocoon. Adjoining restaurant: Kutama has it's own restaurant ( The Blue Nile). The Blue Nile was our first dining experience in Montreal and we were not disappointed! It had a very chic atmosphere/ambiance with a cool, elegant style. The food is Ethiopian and it was delicious! The prices were reasonable and the service was impeccable! One more personal note that I'd like to add - - there was an unfortunate event that took place when we stayed in Montreal. Two doors down from Kutuma ( second nite of our stay) there was a fire that destroyed one and a half buildings. We found this fire around 7:00 p.m. on a Saturday nite. Kutuma was not available to us ( roped off by police/fire emergency crew). We were very worried about our well being, the hotel's and our belongings. The nite wore on without any information on what to do and where to stay. Around 11:00 p.m., one of the staff from the hotel saw us in the street and told us to join them at a neighboring restaurant. The owner of the hotel had sent his staff out in to the streets to try to find/locate people that were staying at Kutuma. The owner paid for us to stay in a 5 star hotel for the evening. He, himself, escorted us to the hotel at 12:00 a.m. to make sure the we were safe and sound in our one night stay. WOW. Do I recommend this hotel.................hell yes. : )

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Will Long Be Remembered”
Reviews.Author: Travelingteacher74
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kutuma.... I should not write about this hotel, for I am sure there will be a day when I want to return, and there will be no vacancy. Yet, this best kept secret deserves to be recognized for the quality of excellence, pride in ownership, and warm hospitality the staff extends to its guests. Attention to detail and making guests a priority are what makes this little hotel rise above all others. The rooms are beautiful, unique in design and filled with small touches that make you know you have arrived at a very special place. The rooms are more like beautiful apartments, with leather couches, brick walls, stainless steel kitchenettes, and soaking tubs. I stayed in the smallest unit, and was totally comfortable and impressed with the space and design. I then had the opportunity to see the larger rooms, and was even more amazed by the space and layout. Standards exist in every aspect, beginning with the thoughtfulness and warm hospitality of the owner, Abby. From offering coffee, an umbrella, or assistance with luggage, Abby extends himself with professionalism and kindness. Standards continue with the highest level of cleanliness, safety , and customer care. I had never eaten Ethiopian food, and am so happy I had dinner at the adjoining hotel. The vegetarian combination platter was amazing!. This continued with the complimentary delicious breakfast of fresh fruit, organic eggs, potatoes and vegetables, and freshly brewed ginger tea. If you are lucky, the chef will make his Ethiopian breakfast speciality, and I promise, you will will be crazing this when you return home. This is a special place, at the top of my list of all-time favorite hotels, which I look forward to returning to again and again. I agree with others, I have never stayed at a more wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “A very unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: frannie456
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the most unique places I've ever stayed, having a fun African theme. The room was exceptionally quiet and clean. My room was located on the 3rd floor and there were no elevators available, which made it tough, because of my bad knees. The location of the hotel was near a subway stop, which made it easy to sightsee and get around. The listing was supposed to be a Bed and Breakfast, but that wasn't true. There was a dining room downstairs, opened for dinner only.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Montreal by far!”
Reviews.Author: greylily
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kutuma is absolutely amazing. The location is perfect. It's close to all the great independent shops near Mont Royal and you can easily walk down to St. Catherines or old Montreal. Besides location the hotel itself is beautifully decorated and very modern. The rooms are huge and fully equipped with a kitchenette and living room. The bathroom was gorgeous and the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on. The room also had a door to a little patio which was covered with plants. The hotel restaurant is also quite nice. It was by far the best Ethiopian I've ever had. The hotel staff are very nice and accommodating. They even gave us two gourmet cakes after dinner compliments of the hotel. I had a great stay at hotel Kutuma and I will definitely stay there the next time I'm in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: kml84
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. Super comfy bed, huge bathroom with a rainfall shower in the middle of the ceiling (which I missed on first glance!). Lots of stairs but it was good to work off all the food! The only thing I didn't like was the TV...everytime you changed the channel you had to unlock the volume control and you also had to turn on the satelite function if you stayed on on channel for too long....very irritating after awhile. Some mentioned that this is a B&B...it IS NOT a B&B...fyi. I would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gottabe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect find. I used to live in Montreal and didn't want to stay in the "tourist" area. This hotel is in the best neighbourhood in Montreal, close to a subway station, restaurants, cafes, and shopping. The tourist sites are also close by. The rooms themselves are amazing. The bathroom gave me great ideas for future renovations! All details are taken care of, including having candles by the bathtub (which would easily fit 2), in case there is time for a relaxing bubble bath. The rooms have a mini-kitchen, too, complete with glassware and fine china! I would have loved to stay longer than one night. Another poster mentioned a smell in the front entrance. You can smell the aroma of the Ethiopian restaurant, but it isn't unpleasant. And you certainly don't smell anything in the rooms themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonSab
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was an awesome experience. Service was exceptional. The hotel itself is very clean, authentic decor and the staff very accommodating. We needed to use the internet due to unexpected events during our stay in Montreal and staff were understanding and helpful. It was all the little things that made the difference, which you would never experience in a large chain hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and absolutely recommend this place. It is very conveniently located and within walking distance to all attractions. Sab and Nicky

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: Bozz56
Reviews.Content: We are aussies on an US and Canada trip. Arrived in the evening and were promptly checked in and pleasantly surprised with the delivery of 2 complimentary drinks to our room shortly after receiving our luggage. Room was spotless and has everything you would need, including real cups wine and beer glasses, 2 burner cooktop, microwave, toaster, coffee perculator hair dryer and iron with board. Free wireless internet which is slow on the top floor but soon sorted it by plugging it in to the ethernet connection conveniently located under the desk. Free bottled water and laundry service! Nice soft bed and great pillows! Not the rubberised ones normally found in hotels. Great location, 5 minutes walk to the Metro which will get you anywhere in Montreal. Tried the Ethiopian restaurant downstairs. Great freindly service, food delicious and enjoyed complimentary desserts. Treated as part of the family. Lots of other restaurants in the area that are also well patronised. About a $15 including tip trip by taxi from Central Station (Amtrak from New York). Dont procrastinate, just book it!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay - original, luxurious, unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: PGMM
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on TripAdvisor we booked two nights at Kutuma and can only say: this is value for money and an unforgettable way to experience Montreal! We had a spacious room with tiger print sheets, sofa and shower curtain and a straw "hat" on the wardrobe closet. Definitely different from "normal" hotels, but very tasteful and consistently decorated. Our room had a fully equipped kitchenette (fridge, microwave, coffee machine, hot plates and kettle), a safe, a breakfast table set for two and a cozy bathroom (with a tub for two and candles(!) as well as toothpaste and toothbrushes in case you forgot). On our second night we had dinner in the (Ethiopian) restaurant on the ground floor and had a pleasant surprise: complementary desert. The hotel is conveniently located between university and downtown Montreal - both within walking distance - and there are plenty shops and restaurants in the direct neighbourhood. When we checked out the mineral water in the fridge turned out to be complementary as well. We left in rather rainy weather and once again: we were given an umbrella to keep, "on the house". These hosts understand what makes a guest feel good, even in bad weather!

Reviews.Title: “It kinda smells a little”
Reviews.Author: WonderLustrUs
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful, a little cute boutique hotel, but it smelled a little funny. The rooms are immaculate; ours came equipped with a little cute kitchen and bathroom. The dÃ©cor is modern and at the same time a little ethnic. We stayed one night because our chosen hotel was full that day. Took a red eye out of SF and therefore got to Montreal very early in the morning. We knew we couldn't check in yet, the front desk person was nice enough to allow us the use of the restaurant bathroom to change and freshen up a bit before we hit the sights and they took care of our luggage too. The Ethiopian restaurant on site was supposed to be the best in town but with all the French food to be had we didn't get to try it. And maybe that's way the hallways and stairways leading up to the roomsâ€™ kind of smell. But the room was gorgeous and definitely didn't smell.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbunnyOttawa
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at this hotel. The location is great, on the busy Rue St Denis (though the rooms are surprisingly quiet). The rooms are decorated in an african theme, and are really well equipped. We were upgraded into a suite with a fabulous bathroom (whirlpool bath for two) and small kitchen. The staff were helpful and very polite. The restaurant downstairs is excellent. The only minor problem we had was regarding breakfast. There is no info on it in the hotel information booklet in your room, so we asked at reception what time it was served, and were told half eight til half ten. We were then told we could have it delivered to our room if we wished, but we declined, and said we'd just come down, assuming it would be served in the restaurant. Following morning we came down and a different member of staff was at reception - we were told breakfast was only served in the rooms and had to be reserved the night before. This really hadn't been communicated to us the previous evening so we were a little put out. However, about ten mins later there was a phonecall to our room, and they had prepared us a continental breakfast which arrived soon after. Overall the room quality and service more than made up for this misunderstanding, but perhaps the management should put info about breakfast in the rooms, or make sure that guests are told about it at check-in. Would definately stay here again and would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “GEM”
Reviews.Author: Chellarella
Reviews.Content: SPOTLESS, helpful staff, wonderful Ethiopian restaurant downstairs. The bathroom was FAB.U.LOUS. The bed was super comfortable and it's in a fab location. I loved this little jewel of a B&B. Worth every nickle. We booked it last minute just for a little getaway and I would return again without hesitation. It's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED, LOVED this little find”
Reviews.Author: SOAP
Reviews.Content: CUTE little hotel with lovely decor, recess lights and wall heaters all around room. It's a deadly cozy full comp little studio with a kitchenette which includes a microwave, fridge, plates and cutlery, kettle and extremly kind and sweet staff. It was my hubby's b'day and they ensured chocos and champagne was waiting for him upon arrival. Lydia was ever so helpful with pointers on where to go. I believe there are only a few rooms (nine) but the touch is so so personal. Full lenght mirrors with makeup zoom mirror in the bathroom (u would be amazed how many chains lack full lenght/head to toe mirrors). Iron/ironing board, cable, disposable tooth brushes, lotion and shampo and a tasty Kutuma brand of coffee which I already miss :( There is a balcony. View is nothing to write home about but it's just a nice to sit out there. I hope my review and pictures helps anyone thinking of booking a room here. The price, location and service surpasses most 5 star hotels. You won't be disappointed. Kutuma is on St Denis Street (Rue St Denis) a block away from the Sherbrooke metro on the orange line and very, very close to all the action including walking distance to Old town and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good experience”
Reviews.Author: shmeab
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on the tripadvisor (thanks for all your advice and opinions), we decided to give it a try-- We loved our room-- it was very cozy and we felt like we were in our own small studio! To update any previous reviews, the bathrooms now have a proper showerhead, so taking a shower was no problem at all! The service was great-- very friendly and genuine people-- even gave us a big umbrella as a souvenir, which they provide at the hotel entrance for the convenience of the guests. I did hear that the restuarant downstairs is great but did not have enough time to go try it-- so many good restaurants in this city~

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Kutuma despite water and itnernet probs.”
Reviews.Author: luckyjodi
Reviews.Content: Was sick of staying in boring big chains for my Montreal business trips and Kutuma got great reviews on Trip Advisor. It lived up to my expectations. I can't believe how nice everything was for the price. - Great location on St. Denis. - The African theme is fun and well-executed. - The hotel upgraded my room upon arrival so I ended up with a gorgeous junior suite with balcony for my $115/night. Incredible deal. - The bed rivals the Westin's dream bed, soft music is playing when you arrive in your room. - there was a complimentary disposable toothbrush for each night of my stay in addition to the regular creams and shampoos, etc. I've forgotten my toothbrush tons of times when traveling so I thought that was cool. - Complimentary big bottle of Kutuma-brand bottled water. - There was a funky kitchenette not only in my jr. suite but also in my colleague's standard queen room. - The staff was really helpful and friendly. - The dinner downstairs at the Nil Bleu was really good. -Complimentary desert was a nice touch. - There's no elevator but there are only 4 floors so no big deal for me. I'm giving this hotel a 5 despite the 2 issues below because frankly I really enjoyed myself and the value was amazing. - I couldn't get an internet connection (the wireless is free, which is great, but I couldn't get a connection and asked for a cable to plug into the connection directly, they gave me one and hooked up my computer for me but that didn't work either - i gave up and didn't bother asking again) - There is no shower (i don't see why they don't just add a hook up on to the wall since there is a hand held shower) and because everyone is taking giant baths in the soaker tubs instead, there was no water at all on our first morning and no hot water on the second. Also, my plug didn't work (I didn't complain though so don't know if it would have been fixed or if I would have been offered a new room) From a convenience and an environmental standpoint (think of all the extra water massive tubs take to fill vs. a quick shower) this sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour - stay at Hotel Kutuma”
Reviews.Author: timpw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Kutuma in December and have to say that I was blown away. Location: It is wonderfully located on St Denis, which as others have said, include great restaurants and some shops/bars. It is a 5 minute walk (even shorter when it's not snowing) to Sherbrooke Metro station. It has a convenience store about 2 stores down, which sells your basics, including alcohol and phone cards if you need to call long distance. Local calls at the Hotel Kutuma are free. Service: From check in to check out, the service was just overwhelming. This small hotel puts the larger chains to shame. I arrived by taxi on the opposite side of the road. It was snowing heavily, but the hotel staff ran across the road (past the mounds of snow) to get my suitcase. They offered me a coffee straight away, and the check in process was over in 5 minutes. They had upgraded me as well, which was a nice surprise (Room 203 I got in the end). Room: Well what can I say, it was superb. The room had light dimmers, which was on when I went into the room. They had also put on some jazz music before I arrived, which was a great touch. The African theme worked very well, and everything was tastefully decorated. ALL ROOMS have been recently renovated to include high tech showers (though water pressure was a bit of a problem), so you don't have to worry about it not having a shower - believe me, you want to see this shower! Flat screen tv, awesome bed, comfy couch, well equipped kitchenette, and cable tv are just a few of the benefits. Amenities: All the usual bathroom products, plus free wi-fi. What more could you ask for? Restaurant: It was quite simply the BEST food I have had for a long time. I have never had Ethiopian food before but seriously, you need to try it. Conclusion: The only bad thing I'll say about it is that it doesn't have a lift (which isn't a problem because they carry your suitcase up for you), and the water pressure was a bit low. But for the price (amazing value), location and general ambiance, you CANNOT GO WRONG.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunicicle
Reviews.Content: The Kutuma hotel was everything it was said to be. A lovely place and the service was fantastic. All the people at the hotel went the extra mile to make our stay special. We were in Montreal to attend the President's Cup. The Hotel is located in a super spot with tons of restaurants. The Blue Nile restaurant in the hotel is really good and was one of the best meals of our trip. Some reviews complained about the lack of shower but our room had a bath and shower. I would certainly stay in this hotel again if I were to go back to Montreal. It was spotless and actually looks like the photos on the website. The friendly atmosphere and willingess to help of all the staff was appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Pefect hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: tamuardo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a large suite, which was the nicest room I have ever stayed in. Comfortable bed, relaxing tub and tons of space. We had to remind ourselves to leave the room and experience the city. The Metro station was only 1 1/2 blocks away and St-Denis had lots of great restaurants and stores, plus we were a stones throw away from St-Louis Square and the pedestrian walkway that leads to St-Laurent. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Top of our list!”
Reviews.Author: crackletops
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the top of our list. We don't like chain hotels or frilly bed and breakfasts and there are few good choices that don't fall into those categories...Kutuma stands on its own. We had similar experiences as the other reviewers. The hotel is family-owned and they were so nice to us. We had bikes with us and Abbi insisted on taking our bikes into the basement every night, after their restaurant closed. When we ate at the restaurant, he gave us free desserts. Overall, we just felt so comfortable there. The room was perfect and so relaxing. Great kitchen, and side door that opens for fresh air...We always felt great coming back to it after a full day out. Just ignore the reviewer who gave the hotel only 3 points, everyone loves this place! We stayed in Old Montreal for the 2nd part of our visit, but I prefer Kutuma's location. Old Montreal is too touristy. Staying here will make you feel like you are not your average tourist.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: Manitobans
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Kutuma is a real gem of a hotel. The theme of the hotel is Africa and they do a super job with the decor. The carpets are in animal print designs as are the bed coverings and artwork. The bathroom was luxurious to say the least with a double whirlpool bath complete with a few scented candles on the side to help you enjoy the experience. Our room had an electric fireplace as well as a kitchen.The staff was helpful and offered good tips about where to eat and catch the metro. The hotel is situated in an area rife with restaurants. There is a park close by . I would say this place is perfect except for the fact that it does not have an elevator. The staff was great and carried our bags for us but the long trudge up and down the flights of stairs was not easy for someone with a bit of a mobility issue.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPandJen
Reviews.Content: Really original hotel with African theme. Lovely suite, beautifully decorated and perfectly clean. The rooms was enormous, as was the bathroom. The kitchen is fully equipped and really modern. There was also a great terrace. Free fast internet and free laundry service. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karlie
Reviews.Content: The Kutuma is an African themed boutique hotel in the heart of Montreal. It is a true boutique hotel, as it only has 9 rooms on 3 floors. Dave and I stayed here for 6 days on our honeymoon. When we called to reserve a few months ahead of time, they told us they would upgrade us if there was anything available. When we got there, they had upgraded us from a junior suite to the deluxe penthouse suite. Every part of our room was gorgeous, from the elephant table in the kitchen to the huge jacuzzi tub. The bed was huge, and was the most comfortable bed I have slept on in my life. I have a lot of trouble getting a good, full night's sleep, and I had no problem during our stay. The decor throughout the hotel follows the African theme, with tan and brown colors, tasteful paintings of wildlife and people, and elegant animal print touches throughout. The only negative is that there is no elevator in the hotel, so it may be difficult for people with limited mobility

Reviews.Title: “what a great find”
Reviews.Author: markandphilippa
Reviews.Content: thanks to fellow trip advisors we booked in at the Kutuma and what a great place it was. Its location is prime as you can walk straight from the hotel a variety of great places. Centre of town is a pleasant walk or metro trip away. The staff were really helpful and could not have done enough or us during our stay. a great boutique location !!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier!”
Reviews.Author: kjpro5
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because the pictures online looked fairly decent for the price and they had an ethiopian restaraunt on the first floor. (which we had never tried) Me and my new wife spent two nights of our honeymoon here and were extatic with our experience. The room was much more than I had expected. The linens were great the room had a kitchen and the bathroom was really really nice. Also every single light in the place had a dim switch on it. The first person we met when we checked in was Abbi. He insisted on helping us with our bags, parked our car for us and offered us something to drink. We modestly said water would be nice, but maybe two minutes later he showed up at our door with mango/papaya/coconut drinks. It was amazing! Abbi was so friendly and eager to help and it seemed like he was working every morning and night that were there. I would definately recomend this place and have to family and friends. Also give the restaraunt a shot, it's very unique and really quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Kutuma”
Reviews.Author: LISA197
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from Apr.21-23 and we loved it. The Kutuma is a boutique hotel and it's decorated beautifully. We stayed in a room with a queen bed, small kitchette, and a bathroom with a big bathtub. There was no shower but the tube had a hand held extension. The front desk usually has one person that runs back and forth from the resturant. Everyone was so nice and tried to help us out in anyway possible. The resturant there was an etiopian style resturant. My husband and I have never had etiopian before but we loved it...it was really good and reasonably priced. Great location. In the middle of shopping/stores on St. Denis. Close to St.Catherines and a bit of a walk to Old Montreal but not too bad...maybe 10-15 min. walk. The manager at the hotel was really nice and always making sure we were ok....would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little getaway in a great part of Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: nycdave
Reviews.Content: Even in the dreary cold middle of winter, Montreal is a great city to visit, and I'm already planning a return trip for the summer -- with the Kutuma as my likely base of operations. Especially in the off-season, when it is barely over 100USD/night for a standard room, this hotel was a great value.
